```{r}
# Import Baltimore population data for 2007-2009 from the CSV file
baltimore_pop_2007_2009 <- read_csv("/Users/raphaelromeroruiz/Downloads/co-est00int-agesex-5yr.csv") %>%
  clean_names() %>%
  # Filter for Baltimore City (you may need to adjust the filter based on how Baltimore is identified in the data)
  filter(str_detect(tolower(sumlev), "baltimore|city") | 
         str_detect(tolower(name), "baltimore city")) %>%
  # Select relevant columns for 2007, 2008, 2009 population estimates
  select(name, contains("2007"), contains("2008"), contains("2009")) %>%
  # Reshape the data to have year and population columns
  pivot_longer(cols = -name, 
               names_to = "year_col", 
               values_to = "population") %>%
  # Extract year from column names
  mutate(year = case_when(
    str_detect(year_col, "2007") ~ 2007,
    str_detect(year_col, "2008") ~ 2008,
    str_detect(year_col, "2009") ~ 2009,
    TRUE ~ NA_real_
  )) %>%
  filter(!is.na(year)) %>%
  # Group by year and sum population (in case there are multiple age/sex categories)
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(population = sum(population, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  arrange(year)

# Display the Baltimore population data for 2007-2009
baltimore_pop_2007_2009
```

```{r}
homicides_wapo <- read_csv("/Users/raphaelromeroruiz/Documents/GitHub/jour772/reverse_engineering_project/data-homicides/homicide-data.csv")
```

```{r}
# First make sure reported_date is in proper date format
homicides_wapo <- homicides_wapo %>%
  mutate(reported_date = ymd(reported_date))
```
```{r}
# Check the date range in our Baltimore data
baltimore_range <- homicides_wapo %>%
  filter(city == "Baltimore") %>%
  summarise(
    earliest = min(reported_date),
    latest = max(reported_date)
  )
```
```{r}
# Get Baltimore homicides and arrests by year before 2015
num_hom_and_arrest_bmore_by_year_pre_2015 <- homicides_wapo %>%
  filter(city == "Baltimore" & reported_date < "2015-01-01") %>%
  mutate(year = year(reported_date)) %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(
    homicides = n(),
    arrests = sum(disposition == "Closed by arrest"),
    arrest_rate = round((sum(disposition == "Closed by arrest") / n()) * 100, 1)
  ) %>%
  arrange(year)  # Sort by year
```
```{r}
# Get population estimates for Baltimore City (post-2015)
pop_estimates_pre_2015 <- get_estimates(
    geography = "county",
    vintage = 2019,
    time_series = TRUE,
    state = "MD",
    county = "510",  # Baltimore City FIPS code
    variable = "POP"
  ) %>%
  # The date column uses Census codes based on official documentation
  mutate(year = case_when(
    DATE == 1 ~ 2010,  # April 1, 2010 Census count
    DATE == 2 ~ NA,  # April 1, 2010 estimates base (not used)
    DATE == 3 ~ NA,  # July 1, 2010 estimate (not used)
    DATE == 4 ~ 2011,  # July 1, 2011 estimate
    DATE == 5 ~ 2012,  # July 1, 2012 estimate
    DATE == 6 ~ 2013,  # July 1, 2013 estimate
    DATE == 7 ~ 2014,  # July 1, 2014 estimate
    DATE == 8 ~ 2015,  # July 1, 2015 estimate
    DATE == 9 ~ 2016,  # July 1, 2016 estimate
    DATE == 10 ~ 2017, # July 1, 2017 estimate
    DATE == 11 ~ 2018, # July 1, 2018 estimate
    DATE == 12 ~ 2019, # July 1, 2019 estimate
    TRUE ~ as.numeric(DATE)
  )) %>%
  select(year, value) %>%
  rename(population = value) %>%
  filter(year >= 2010 & year <= 2014) %>%
  arrange(year)
```
```{r}
# Get population estimates for Baltimore City (post-2015)
pop_estimates_post_2015 <- get_estimates(
    geography = "county",
    vintage = 2019,
    time_series = TRUE,
    state = "MD",
    county = "510",  # Baltimore City FIPS code (full code)
    variable = "POP"
  ) %>%
  # The date column uses Census codes based on official documentation
  mutate(year = case_when(
    DATE == 1 ~ 2010,  # April 1, 2010 Census count
    DATE == 2 ~ 2010,  # April 1, 2010 estimates base
    DATE == 3 ~ 2010,  # July 1, 2010 estimate
    DATE == 4 ~ 2011,  # July 1, 2011 estimate
    DATE == 5 ~ 2012,  # July 1, 2012 estimate
    DATE == 6 ~ 2013,  # July 1, 2013 estimate
    DATE == 7 ~ 2014,  # July 1, 2014 estimate
    DATE == 8 ~ 2015,  # July 1, 2015 estimate
    DATE == 9 ~ 2016,  # July 1, 2016 estimate
    DATE == 10 ~ 2017, # July 1, 2017 estimate
    DATE == 11 ~ 2018, # July 1, 2018 estimate
    DATE == 12 ~ 2019, # July 1, 2019 estimate
    TRUE ~ as.numeric(DATE)
  )) %>%
  select(year, value) %>%
  rename(population = value) %>%
  filter(year >= 2015 & year <= 2017) %>%
  arrange(year)
```
```{r}
# Get Baltimore homicides and arrests for 2015-2017
num_hom_and_arrests_bmore_by_year_post_2015 <- homicides_wapo %>%
  filter(city == "Baltimore" & reported_date >= "2015-01-01" & reported_date <= "2017-12-31") %>%
  mutate(year = year(reported_date)) %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarise(
    homicides = n(),
    arrests = sum(disposition == "Closed by arrest"),
    arrest_rate = round((sum(disposition == "Closed by arrest") / n()) * 100, 1)
  ) %>%
  arrange(year)
```
```{r}
# Combine all population data (2007-2009 from CSV + 2010-2014 from Census API)
all_population_data <- bind_rows(
  baltimore_pop_2007_2009,
  pop_estimates_pre_2015
) %>%
  arrange(year)

# Calculate pre-2015 rates (including 2007-2009 data)
bmore_hom_rates_pre_2015 <- num_hom_and_arrest_bmore_by_year_pre_2015 %>%
  left_join(all_population_data, by = "year") %>%
  mutate(homicide_rate_per_100k = round((homicides / population) * 100000, 1))
```
```{r}
# Calculate post-2015 rates
bmore_hom_rates_post_2015 <- num_hom_and_arrests_bmore_by_year_post_2015 %>%
  left_join(pop_estimates_post_2015, by = "year") %>%
  mutate(homicide_rate_per_100k = round((homicides / population) * 100000, 1))
```

```{r}
# Calculate statistics for pre-2015
total_homicides_pre_2015 <- sum(num_hom_and_arrest_bmore_by_year_pre_2015$homicides)
total_arrests_pre_2015 <- sum(num_hom_and_arrest_bmore_by_year_pre_2015$arrests)
avg_rate_pre_2015 <- round(mean(bmore_hom_rates_pre_2015$homicide_rate_per_100k), 1)
avg_arrest_rate_pre_2015 <- round(mean(num_hom_and_arrest_bmore_by_year_pre_2015$arrest_rate), 1)

# Calculate statistics for post-2015
total_homicides_post_2015 <- sum(num_hom_and_arrests_bmore_by_year_post_2015$homicides)
total_arrests_post_2015 <- sum(num_hom_and_arrests_bmore_by_year_post_2015$arrests)
avg_arrest_rate_post_2015 <- round(mean(num_hom_and_arrests_bmore_by_year_post_2015$arrest_rate), 1)

# Calculate change in arrest rates
arrest_rate_change <- avg_arrest_rate_post_2015 - avg_arrest_rate_pre_2015

# Combine all years into one comparison
all_years <- bind_rows(
  bmore_hom_rates_pre_2015,
  bmore_hom_rates_post_2015
) %>%
  arrange(year)
```
